page.title: 19HOWE OF FIFE
page.content: {The Howe of Fife is a naturally {fertile valley sheltered from the West {& East by the Lomond and Kettle Hills. It is a{rich farming area with a large {part of the land covered in coniferous {woods. In March & April the winds are {very strong blowing the top soil from {the fields across Ladybank, sometimes {blocking the roads.}This problem will {increase as the trees are being felled having reached{maturity. Ecologists are{concerned about the effects on {wildlife, especially the deer.}The {Sand & Gravel Co.}are expanding {rapidly extracting large quantities of {sand and gravel required for building {purposes. The river Eden flows through {the valley from west to east heading {for St. Andrews Bay where it flows {into the North Sea. The river is used for trout fishing and irrigation.
